thread.title: Calipari says Wildcats playing like 'fraidy cats
thread.title_full: Calipari says Wildcats playing like 'fraidy cats

title: Calipari says Wildcats playing like 'fraidy cats
text:
Calipari says Wildcats playing like 'fraidy cats John Calipari says his team played scared at Missouri. 
Kentucky struggled to put away lowly Missouri during a 72-62 win in Columbia Tuesday night and afterward, head coach John Calipari didn't mince words. 
Calipari said his Wildcats played more like 'fraidy cats. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
"We had guys playing scared," Calipari said. "If you're afraid of Missouri, how are you going to play in that [NCAA] Tournament?" 
Kentucky (23-5, 13-2 SEC) led Missouri (7-20, 2-13) 31-30 at halftime and found themselves deadlocked at 52-52 with 7:42 remaining before pulling away late. 
The Wildcats shot 46.2 percent from the floor but tied a season-high with 17 turnovers and if it weren't for a career-night from Bam Adebayo (22 points, 15 rebounds), they may have suffered a catastrophic late-season defeat. 
Calipari seemed to indicate after the game that his team may be suffering from a crisis of confidence. 
"We're a long way away. We're not confident enough," Calipari said. "We should be. I don't get it." 
He seemed to single out some of UK's veteran players. 
"I don't understand guys, especially seniors, not being excited to show what they're about." 
After losing three of four in late January and early February, the Wildcats have now reeled off five wins in a row, but are far from playing its best basketball of the season. 
They'll need to be at their best Saturday when they host No. 12 Florida (23-5, 13-2 SEC) in a game that will likely decide the SEC regular season championship. Author
